24namespace { // for String.fromCodePoint
25
26bool IsValidCodePoint(Isolate* isolate, Handle<Object> value) {
27 if (!IsNumber(*value) && !Object::ToNumber(isolate, value).ToHandle(&value)) {
28 return false;
29 }
30
31 if (Object::Number(*Object::ToInteger(isolate, value).ToHandleChecked()) !=
32 Object::Number(*value)) {
33 return false;
34 }
35
36 if (Object::Number(*value) < 0 || Object::Number(*value) > 0x10FFFF) {
37 return false;
38 }
39
40 return true;
41}
42
43static constexpr base::uc32 kInvalidCodePoint = static_cast<base::uc32>(-1);
44
45base::uc32 NextCodePoint(Isolate* isolate, BuiltinArguments args, int index) {
46 Handle<Object> value = args.at(1 + index);
47 ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(
48 isolate, value, Object::ToNumber(isolate, value), kInvalidCodePoint);
49 if (!IsValidCodePoint(isolate, value)) {
50 isolate->Throw(*isolate->factory()->NewRangeError(
51 MessageTemplate::kInvalidCodePoint, value));
52 return kInvalidCodePoint;
53 }
54 return DoubleToUint32(Object::Number(*value));
55}
56
57} // namespace
58
59// ES6 section 21.1.2.2 String.fromCodePoint ( ...codePoints )
60BUILTIN(StringFromCodePoint) {
61 HandleScope scope(isolate);
62 int const length = args.length() - 1;
63 if (length == 0) return ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).empty_string();
64 DCHECK_LT(0, length);
65
66 // Optimistically assume that the resulting String contains only one byte
67 // characters.
68 std::vector<uint8_t> one_byte_buffer;
69 one_byte_buffer.reserve(length);
70 base::uc32 code = 0;
71 int index;
72 for (index = 0; index < length; index++) {
73 code = NextCodePoint(isolate, args, index);
74 if (code == kInvalidCodePoint) {
75 return ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).exception();
76 }
77 if (code > String::kMaxOneByteCharCode) {
78 break;
79 }
80 one_byte_buffer.push_back(code);
81 }
82
83 if (index == length) {
84 RETURN_RESULT_OR_FAILURE(
85 isolate, isolate->factory()->NewStringFromOneByte(base::Vector<uint8_t>(
86 one_byte_buffer.data(), one_byte_buffer.size())));
87 }
88
89 std::vector<base::uc16> two_byte_buffer;
90 two_byte_buffer.reserve(length - index);
91
92 while (true) {
93 if (code <=
94 static_cast<base::uc32>(unibrow::Utf16::kMaxNonSurrogateCharCode)) {
95 two_byte_buffer.push_back(code);
96 } else {
97 two_byte_buffer.push_back(unibrow::Utf16::LeadSurrogate(code));
98 two_byte_buffer.push_back(unibrow::Utf16::TrailSurrogate(code));
99 }
100
101 if (++index == length) {
102 break;
103 }
104 code = NextCodePoint(isolate, args, index);
105 if (code == kInvalidCodePoint) {
106 return ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).exception();
107 }
108 }
109
110 Handle<SeqTwoByteString> result;
111 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
112 isolate, result,
113 isolate->factory()->NewRawTwoByteString(
114 static_cast<int>(one_byte_buffer.size() + two_byte_buffer.size())));
115
116 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
117 CopyChars(result->GetChars(no_gc), one_byte_buffer.data(),
118 one_byte_buffer.size());
119 CopyChars(result->GetChars(no_gc) + one_byte_buffer.size(),
120 two_byte_buffer.data(), two_byte_buffer.size());
121
122 return *result;
123}
124
125// ES6 section 21.1.3.9
126// String.prototype.lastIndexOf ( searchString [ , position ] )
127BUILTIN(StringPrototypeLastIndexOf) {
128 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
129 return String::LastIndexOf(isolate, args.receiver(),
130 args.atOrUndefined(isolate, 1),
131 args.atOrUndefined(isolate, 2));
132}
133
134// ES6 section 21.1.3.10 String.prototype.localeCompare ( that )
135//
136// This function is implementation specific. For now, we do not
137// do anything locale specific.
138BUILTIN(StringPrototypeLocaleCompare) {
139 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
140
141 isolate->CountUsage(v8::Isolate::UseCounterFeature::kStringLocaleCompare);
142 static const char* const kMethod = "String.prototype.localeCompare";
143
144#ifdef V8_INTL_SUPPORT
145 TO_THIS_STRING(str1, kMethod);
146 Handle<String> str2;
147 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
148 isolate, str2, Object::ToString(isolate, args.atOrUndefined(isolate, 1)));
149 base::Optional<int> result = Intl::StringLocaleCompare(
150 isolate, str1, str2, args.atOrUndefined(isolate, 2),
151 args.atOrUndefined(isolate, 3), kMethod);
152 if (!result.has_value()) {
153 DCHECK(isolate->has_exception());
154 return ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).exception();
155 }
156 return Smi::FromInt(result.value());
157#else
158 DCHECK_LE(2, args.length());
159
160 TO_THIS_STRING(str1, kMethod);
161 Handle<String> str2;
162 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, str2,
163 Object::ToString(isolate, args.at(1)));
164
165 if (str1.is_identical_to(str2)) return Smi::zero(); // Equal.
166 int str1_length = str1->length();
167 int str2_length = str2->length();
168
169 // Decide trivial cases without flattening.
170 if (str1_length == 0) {
171 if (str2_length == 0) return Smi::zero(); // Equal.
172 return Smi::FromInt(-str2_length);
173 } else {
174 if (str2_length == 0) return Smi::FromInt(str1_length);
175 }
176
177 int end = str1_length < str2_length ? str1_length : str2_length;
178
179 // No need to flatten if we are going to find the answer on the first
180 // character. At this point we know there is at least one character
181 // in each string, due to the trivial case handling above.
182 int d = str1->Get(0) - str2->Get(0);
183 if (d != 0) return Smi::FromInt(d);
184
185 str1 = String::Flatten(isolate, str1);
186 str2 = String::Flatten(isolate, str2);
187
188 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
189 String::FlatContent flat1 = str1->GetFlatContent(no_gc);
190 String::FlatContent flat2 = str2->GetFlatContent(no_gc);
191
192 for (int i = 0; i < end; i++) {
193 if (flat1.Get(i) != flat2.Get(i)) {
194 return Smi::FromInt(flat1.Get(i) - flat2.Get(i));
195 }
196 }
197
198 return Smi::FromInt(str1_length - str2_length);
199#endif // !V8_INTL_SUPPORT
200}
201
202#ifndef V8_INTL_SUPPORT
203// ES6 section 21.1.3.12 String.prototype.normalize ( [form] )
204//
205// Simply checks the argument is valid and returns the string itself.
206// If internationalization is enabled, then intl.js will override this function
207// and provide the proper functionality, so this is just a fallback.
208BUILTIN(StringPrototypeNormalize) {
209 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
210 TO_THIS_STRING(string, "String.prototype.normalize");
211
212 Handle<Object> form_input = args.atOrUndefined(isolate, 1);
213 if (IsUndefined(*form_input, isolate)) return *string;
214
215 Handle<String> form;
216 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, form,
217 Object::ToString(isolate, form_input));
218
219 if (!(String::Equals(isolate, form, isolate->factory()->NFC_string()) ||
220 String::Equals(isolate, form, isolate->factory()->NFD_string()) ||
221 String::Equals(isolate, form, isolate->factory()->NFKC_string()) ||
222 String::Equals(isolate, form, isolate->factory()->NFKD_string()))) {
223 Handle<String> valid_forms =
224 isolate->factory()->NewStringFromStaticChars("NFC, NFD, NFKC, NFKD");
225 THROW_NEW_ERROR_RETURN_FAILURE(
226 isolate,
227 NewRangeError(MessageTemplate::kNormalizationForm, valid_forms));
228 }
229
230 return *string;
231}
232#endif // !V8_INTL_SUPPORT
233
234
235#ifndef V8_INTL_SUPPORT
236namespace {
237
238inline bool ToUpperOverflows(base::uc32 character) {
239 // y with umlauts and the micro sign are the only characters that stop
240 // fitting into one-byte when converting to uppercase.
241 static const base::uc32 yuml_code = 0xFF;
242 static const base::uc32 micro_code = 0xB5;
243 return (character == yuml_code || character == micro_code);
244}
245
246template <class Converter>
247V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT static Tagged<Object> ConvertCaseHelper(
248 Isolate* isolate, Tagged<String> string, Tagged<SeqString> result,
249 int result_length, unibrow::Mapping<Converter, 128>* mapping) {
250 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
251 // We try this twice, once with the assumption that the result is no longer
252 // than the input and, if that assumption breaks, again with the exact
253 // length. This may not be pretty, but it is nicer than what was here before
254 // and I hereby claim my vaffel-is.
255 //
256 // NOTE: This assumes that the upper/lower case of an ASCII
257 // character is also ASCII. This is currently the case, but it
258 // might break in the future if we implement more context and locale
259 // dependent upper/lower conversions.
260 bool has_changed_character = false;
261
262 // Convert all characters to upper case, assuming that they will fit
263 // in the buffer
264 StringCharacterStream stream(string);
265 unibrow::uchar chars[Converter::kMaxWidth];
266 // We can assume that the string is not empty
267 base::uc32 current = stream.GetNext();
268 bool ignore_overflow = Converter::kIsToLower || IsSeqTwoByteString(result);
269 for (int i = 0; i < result_length;) {
270 bool has_next = stream.HasMore();
271 base::uc32 next = has_next ? stream.GetNext() : 0;
272 int char_length = mapping->get(current, next, chars);
273 if (char_length == 0) {
274 // The case conversion of this character is the character itself.
275 result->Set(i, current);
276 i++;
277 } else if (char_length == 1 &&
278 (ignore_overflow || !ToUpperOverflows(current))) {
279 // Common case: converting the letter resulted in one character.
280 DCHECK(static_cast<base::uc32>(chars[0]) != current);
281 result->Set(i, chars[0]);
282 has_changed_character = true;
283 i++;
284 } else if (result_length == string->length()) {
285 bool overflows = ToUpperOverflows(current);
286 // We've assumed that the result would be as long as the
287 // input but here is a character that converts to several
288 // characters. No matter, we calculate the exact length
289 // of the result and try the whole thing again.
290 //
291 // Note that this leaves room for optimization. We could just
292 // memcpy what we already have to the result string. Also,
293 // the result string is the last object allocated we could
294 // "realloc" it and probably, in the vast majority of cases,
295 // extend the existing string to be able to hold the full
296 // result.
297 int next_length = 0;
298 if (has_next) {
299 next_length = mapping->get(next, 0, chars);
300 if (next_length == 0) next_length = 1;
301 }
302 int current_length = i + char_length + next_length;
303 while (stream.HasMore()) {
304 current = stream.GetNext();
305 overflows |= ToUpperOverflows(current);
306 // NOTE: we use 0 as the next character here because, while
307 // the next character may affect what a character converts to,
308 // it does not in any case affect the length of what it convert
309 // to.
310 int char_length = mapping->get(current, 0, chars);
311 if (char_length == 0) char_length = 1;
312 current_length += char_length;
313 if (current_length > String::kMaxLength) {
314 AllowGarbageCollection allocate_error_and_return;
315 THROW_NEW_ERROR_RETURN_FAILURE(isolate,
316 NewInvalidStringLengthError());
317 }
318 }
319 // Try again with the real length. Return signed if we need
320 // to allocate a two-byte string for to uppercase.
321 return (overflows && !ignore_overflow) ? Smi::FromInt(-current_length)
322 : Smi::FromInt(current_length);
323 } else {
324 for (int j = 0; j < char_length; j++) {
325 result->Set(i, chars[j]);
326 i++;
327 }
328 has_changed_character = true;
329 }
330 current = next;
331 }
332 if (has_changed_character) {
333 return result;
334 } else {
335 // If we didn't actually change anything in doing the conversion
336 // we simple return the result and let the converted string
337 // become garbage; there is no reason to keep two identical strings
338 // alive.
339 return string;
340 }
341}
342
343template <class Converter>
344V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT static Tagged<Object> ConvertCase(
345 Handle<String> s, Isolate* isolate,
346 unibrow::Mapping<Converter, 128>* mapping) {
347 s = String::Flatten(isolate, s);
348 int length = s->length();
349 // Assume that the string is not empty; we need this assumption later
350 if (length == 0) return *s;
351
352 // Simpler handling of ASCII strings.
353 //
354 // NOTE: This assumes that the upper/lower case of an ASCII
355 // character is also ASCII. This is currently the case, but it
356 // might break in the future if we implement more context and locale
357 // dependent upper/lower conversions.
358 if (String::IsOneByteRepresentationUnderneath(*s)) {
359 // Same length as input.
360 Handle<SeqOneByteString> result =
361 isolate->factory()->NewRawOneByteString(length).ToHandleChecked();
362 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
363 String::FlatContent flat_content = s->GetFlatContent(no_gc);
364 DCHECK(flat_content.IsFlat());
365 bool has_changed_character = false;
366 int index_to_first_unprocessed = FastAsciiConvert<Converter::kIsToLower>(
367 reinterpret_cast<char*>(result->GetChars(no_gc)),
368 reinterpret_cast<const char*>(flat_content.ToOneByteVector().begin()),
369 length, &has_changed_character);
370 // If not ASCII, we discard the result and take the 2 byte path.
371 if (index_to_first_unprocessed == length)
372 return has_changed_character ? *result : *s;
373 }
374
375 Handle<SeqString> result; // Same length as input.
376 if (s->IsOneByteRepresentation()) {
377 result = isolate->factory()->NewRawOneByteString(length).ToHandleChecked();
378 } else {
379 result = isolate->factory()->NewRawTwoByteString(length).ToHandleChecked();
380 }
381
382 Tagged<Object> answer =
383 ConvertCaseHelper(isolate, *s, *result, length, mapping);
384 if (IsException(answer, isolate) || IsString(answer)) return answer;
385
386 DCHECK(IsSmi(answer));
387 length = Smi::ToInt(answer);
388 if (s->IsOneByteRepresentation() && length > 0) {
389 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
390 isolate, result, isolate->factory()->NewRawOneByteString(length));
391 } else {
392 if (length < 0) length = -length;
393 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
394 isolate, result, isolate->factory()->NewRawTwoByteString(length));
395 }
396 return ConvertCaseHelper(isolate, *s, *result, length, mapping);
397}
398
399} // namespace
400
401BUILTIN(StringPrototypeToLocaleLowerCase) {
402 HandleScope scope(isolate);
403 TO_THIS_STRING(string, "String.prototype.toLocaleLowerCase");
404 return ConvertCase(string, isolate,
405 isolate->runtime_state()->to_lower_mapping());
406}
407
408BUILTIN(StringPrototypeToLocaleUpperCase) {
409 HandleScope scope(isolate);
410 TO_THIS_STRING(string, "String.prototype.toLocaleUpperCase");
411 return ConvertCase(string, isolate,
412 isolate->runtime_state()->to_upper_mapping());
413}
414
415BUILTIN(StringPrototypeToLowerCase) {
416 HandleScope scope(isolate);
417 TO_THIS_STRING(string, "String.prototype.toLowerCase");
418 return ConvertCase(string, isolate,
419 isolate->runtime_state()->to_lower_mapping());
420}
421
422BUILTIN(StringPrototypeToUpperCase) {
423 HandleScope scope(isolate);
424 TO_THIS_STRING(string, "String.prototype.toUpperCase");
425 return ConvertCase(string, isolate,
426 isolate->runtime_state()->to_upper_mapping());
427}
428#endif // !V8_INTL_SUPPORT
429
430// ES6 #sec-string.prototype.raw
431BUILTIN(StringRaw) {
432 HandleScope scope(isolate);
433 Handle<Object> templ = args.atOrUndefined(isolate, 1);
434 const uint32_t argc = args.length();
435 Handle<String> raw_string =
436 isolate->factory()->NewStringFromAsciiChecked("raw");
437
438 Handle<Object> cooked;
439 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, cooked,
440 Object::ToObject(isolate, templ));
441
442 Handle<Object> raw;
443 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
444 isolate, raw, Object::GetProperty(isolate, cooked, raw_string));
445 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, raw,
446 Object::ToObject(isolate, raw));
447 Handle<Object> raw_len;
448 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
449 isolate, raw_len,
450 Object::GetProperty(isolate, raw, isolate->factory()->length_string()));
451
452 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, raw_len,
453 Object::ToLength(isolate, raw_len));
454
455 IncrementalStringBuilder result_builder(isolate);
456 // Intentional spec violation: we ignore {length} values >= 2^32, because
457 // assuming non-empty chunks they would generate too-long strings anyway.
458 const double raw_len_number = Object::Number(*raw_len);
459 const uint32_t length = raw_len_number > std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max()
460 ? std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max()
461 : static_cast<uint32_t>(raw_len_number);
462 if (length > 0) {
463 Handle<Object> first_element;
464 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, first_element,
465 Object::GetElement(isolate, raw, 0));
466
467 Handle<String> first_string;
468 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
469 isolate, first_string, Object::ToString(isolate, first_element));
470 result_builder.AppendString(first_string);
471
472 for (uint32_t i = 1, arg_i = 2; i < length; i++, arg_i++) {
473 if (arg_i < argc) {
474 Handle<String> argument_string;
475 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
476 isolate, argument_string,
477 Object::ToString(isolate, args.at(arg_i)));
478 result_builder.AppendString(argument_string);
479 }
480
481 Handle<Object> element;
482 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, element,
483 Object::GetElement(isolate, raw, i));
484
485 Handle<String> element_string;
486 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, element_string,
487 Object::ToString(isolate, element));
488 result_builder.AppendString(element_string);
489 }
490 }
491
492 RETURN_RESULT_OR_FAILURE(isolate, result_builder.Finish());
493}
